Fifteen distinct species of dragon have been observed in the wake of the Dragonsurge, and dragons of a similar type often behaved similarly in the years since:

  • Metallic dragons (generally of a selfless disposition)
    • Gold dragons: Self-organized into the Shining Justicars; an extra-judicial militia of peace-bringers who travel the land righting any perceived wrongs
    • Silver dragons: Often went into hiding in plain sight as ordinary humanoids; no formal collective of them is known
    • Brass dragons: Commonly built up their treasure hoards through mercenary work, commonly taking jobs protecting Wrakarr trade caravans from blue dragons
    • Bronze dragons: Many of them came upon an area that they felt was not sufficiently fortified, and instituted local martial law with armies they raised
    • Copper dragons: TODO
  • Gem dragons (generally of an indifferent disposition toward others)
    • Amethyst dragons: Many used their newfound power to declare themselves feudal monarchs of a region, and took to managing the affairs of their new constituents
    • Emerald dragons: After the loss of the Bastion in Archerald, the next largest repository of knowledge became the remaining ancient emerald dragons living on the Tahimik Islands. Many newly of the new emerald dragons created by the surge decided to aid them in growing and maintaining their archive, and formed the
    • Sapphire dragons: After the Dragonsurge, new sapphire dragons encountered hostility in the ocean depths they preferred as a habitat; they fought both the ancient pre-surge sapphires and each other for control of the waters, eventually conscripting many of the ocean's inhabitants into their endless war games with each other
    • Crystal dragons: After the Great Schism of the Church of Hroknar, many citizens of the fallen Istovian Empire sought external protection, which they commonly found under the wings of the crystal dragons who flocked to the area, establishing domains on the mountains' harsh surface
    • Topaz dragons: Commonly became apex predators in their arctic environments of choice, instilling fear in the local inhabitants
  • Chromatic dragons (generally of a self-interested disposition)
    • Red dragons: Laid claim to a territory and its people, ruling with absolute unchecked authority
    • Blue dragons: Took up profiteering, usually around the emerging merchant cities of Wrakarr
    • Green dragons: Commonly became apex predators in their forested environments of choice, instilling fear in the local inhabitants
    • Black dragons: Commonly became apex predators in their swampy environments of choice, instilling fear in the local inhabitants
    • White dragons: Commonly became apex predators in their arctic environments of choice, instilling fear in the local inhabitants

When dragons deign to mate with humans, a semi-draconic bloodline can be produced: “draconic sorcerers” in the case of a male dragon, and humanoids known as “dragonborn” in the case of a female dragon
